page.title: 17Roller Skating.
page.content: I spend much of my weekend roller skating. I belong to the Thames Valley Roller Skating Club. The club is run by Ron and Molly Cuton and has 100 members. We use the Old Goal Leisure Centre in Abingdon. We pay for a membership card which lets us use the Old Goal's skating room and hire their skates for free. On Saturday morning I have a lesson at 8.30am and then afterwards I continue to skate in the general public sessions where anyone can come in and hire a pair of skates and have a go. The session ends around lunchtime. On Sunday afternoons I also roller skate, from about 4.30 to 6.30. In this session we play a game and also have some competitions for who can skate the fastest and who can do the most tricks.
